item.title: Bins on the pavement, 6th August
item.description:
Disabled pedestrians have to use the road to pass this area. This is the middle of three houses that keep their bins on the pavement permanently. It is dangerous and selfish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birling Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Fly tipping by reaidents, 6th August
item.description:
Have a persistent problem of other residents at Gaumont House leaving their rubbish on the street and not using the provided bin stores which use generic FB keys. The rubbish is often split by vermin and spread across the street exacerbating the fly tipping and littering problem we have. In this case they have helpful left their address of 28 Gaumont house on the box.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree sprouts/weeds blocking the view, 6th August
item.description:
The trees alongside cyclepath have overgrown sprouts and weeds from the trunks, not only it blocks one lane if the cycling lane it's almost impossible to see incoming bikers when exiting Christchurch way, witnessed near collision again today as well as yesterday.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ditch Alley, London

item.title: Loose manhole cover on Dartmouth Row, 6th August
item.description:
This manhole cover has been loose for some weeks, possibly longer. It is regularly driven over and makes a loud noise in the process, which seems to be getting worse and is even more disturbing at night. It's actually woken me up in the early hours of the morning!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Dartmouth Row, Deptford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noise from people sitting and talking at midnight loudly from bench, 6th August

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Crack and dip in Road surface, 5th August
item.description:
This issue was reported by someone else around beginning of July. Someone has been out to see the issue as spray markings are on each corner of the subsidence a couple of weeks ago at least. However when I looked on here to check progress the report has now gone. Can you please update when repairs will happen as I worry every time I along with other car drivers I know worry when we have to drive over the area daily. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Haslemere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
